intro.description: Here you will learn how to deal with GIT in the IDE. You can configure some repositories and import the projects you need

item.title: Open GIT Perspective
item.description: First of all, we need to open the GIT Perspective using the menu "Window->Perspective->Open Perspective->Other" and select "Git" perspective

item.title: Clone an existing Repository from a URL
item.description: In the "Git Repositories" view, click on the button "Clone a Git Repository and add the clone to this view". This will open a dialog where you can type the URL and provide authentication if needed for the connection

item.title: Import an existing Project into the Workspace
item.description: Browse the added repository (the "Working Tree" leaf) and select the folder you want to import. Right click on it and select "Import projects" action. Follow the steps in the wizard in order to import the existing Eclipse Projects to the Workspace
